16.plot: Pastor Dale and Barbara Cochran from Hannibal Free Will Baptist Church in Hannibal, Missouri sit down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection. Among the topics discussed are the Angel food Ministries.

19.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers discusses the Faith Assembly Outreach event on the Outreach Connection program.

20.title: KJIR Radio 'Mike @ the mic': Michael Wortman
20.plot: Pastor Mike Wortman from KJIR radio "The Cross" 91.7 FM in Hannibal Missouri sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

21.title: Jake's Boys' Music Ministry
21.plot: Jake's Boys Music Ministry sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Jake's Boys Music Ministry are a southern gospel group from the Gibson City, Illinois area that have been singing together since early 1997.

22.plot:

23.title: Pastor Howell: Food/Clothing Outreach
23.plot: Pastor Howell sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The discussion touches on several topics including the Food and clothing outreach.

24.title: Well House Jail Ministry
24.plot: Host Debra Peppers discusses Well House Jail Ministries, a God-based foundation helping women transition from incarceration to well-balanced community living.

25.title: Author David Kerr: The Ol' Turkey Hunter
25.plot: Author David Kerr who calls him self The Ol' Turkey Hunter sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The discussion touches on several topics. Kerr would also make another appearance on the program in October 2010.

26.title: Donette Douglas: Ways to Reach Out
26.plot: Donette Douglas, Christian Television Network WTJR station GM/Director sits down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection. The discussion touches on ways viewers can reach out to support Christian TV programs like Outreach connection on the Christian Television Network.

27.title: Dixie Forte/Spencer Camp: Revival
27.plot: Dixie Forte and Spencer Camp talk about a Revival as they sit down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection.

28.title: Jeff Foster: Way of the Master
28.plot: Jeff Foster, Way of the Master sits down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection.

29.title: Crisandra
29.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

30.title: Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch
30.plot: Jay Craig, Stewardship Director with Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch sits down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection.

31.title: Christian Motorcycle Club
31.plot: Christian Motorcycle club topic with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection. specifically the Longriders Quincy Illinois Chapter.

32.title: Becky Smith: Chrysalis Home
32.plot: Becky Smith, Director, Chrysalis home sits down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection. Becky Smith, director of the home, worked with a board to plan the concept of the home, find and renovate the house in rural Hancock County near Adrian, and develop the program to help the residents. After hours of volunteer time and donations of furnishings and money, the home was completed a few months ago (April 2007).

33.title: Loraine Bossaller: Called Anointed Sent - Non-Profit Ministry
33.plot: Loraine Bossaller, Called Anointed Sent, Non-Profit Ministry President and founder sits down with Dr. Peppers on Outreach Connection. CAS Projects started in 1999 Chartered as a 501c3 of Called Anointed Sent, with a vision for a food pantry for the Maries RII School district area being our primary target. Late 1999, a clothing outreach was established.

34.title: Peggy Dresden/Susan Asher: Right to Life
34.plot: Susan Asher, Pro-Life Ministry chair person and Peggy Dresden, Faith & Freedom Family Ministries leader sit down with Dr.Debra Peppers on Outreach Connection. Topics include the Anti-Abortion stance and Right to Life.

35.title: Tom Waters: Abundant Life Ministries
35.plot: Abundant Life Ministries Evangelist Tom Waters sits down with Dr.Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Tom is also host of the CTN-WTJR Program titled "The Song and the Word". Tom talks about songs and hymns with his piano playing gift.

36.title: Rev. Jerald Jenkins/Dr. Gary Schluckebier: Addicts Victorious
36.plot: Director of Biblical Counseling, Dr. Gary Schluckebier and Jerry Jenkins the founder of Addicts Victorious sit down with Dr.Debra Peppers on Outreach Connection.

37.title: Principal Randy Peterson: Quincy Christian School
37.plot: New Principal Randy Peterson, the first-year head administrator of Quincy Christian School (Quincy Illinois), sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

38.title: Rev. Mickey Farlow: Calvary Baptist Church
38.plot: Rev. Mickey Farlow, pastor of Calvary Baptist Church, Quincy, IL sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on Outreach Connection. In August 2005, Rev. Mickey Farlow became the eighth pastor of Calvary Baptist Church in Quincy, IL. Mickey Farlow was associate pastor at Altoona Regular Baptist Church (Altoona, Iowa) from 1977-1989 he is married to Joyce who also spent time serving the Altoona youth.

39.title: Chuck Smith: New Start Rescue Mission
39.plot: Rev.Chuck Smith, of New Start Rescue Mission, Quincy, IL sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers on Outreach Connection. On October 21, 2007, New Start Rescue Mission reopened its doors. The center was closed last year due to some critical safety violations. The center is now newly painted and refurnished, ready to help those in need. New Start was founded by Rev.Chuck Smith and his wife Deborah to give men help changing their lives. Smith wants to help men find work and help guide them to what they want to do in life.

40.title: Bishop E.L. Warren
40.plot: Member of the International Communion of Charismatic Churches, Bishop E.L. Warren sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

41.title: Baptist Missionary Library Fund
41.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

42.title: Rev. Jerald F. Jenkins: Biblical Counseling - Addicts Victorious
42.plot: Executive Director of Addicts Victorious Reverend Jerald F. Jenkins sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. There are several topics including Christian counseling and drug treatment.

43.title: Camp Penuel: Reverend Harry H. Douma
43.plot: REV. Harry H. Douma sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Rev. Douma was born in New York, placed in an orphanage at the age of two and adopted at six. In 1973 Rev. Douma founded Camp Penuel on Lake Killarney in Ironton, MO, which has expanded to Camp Penuel East in Eldred, PA, and to Esparsa, Costa Rica. Camp Penuel works with service agencies and churches to enroll children ages 7-11 in their communities and neighborhoods. Each group is responsible for providing adults to live with the children during their stay.

44.title: Quest for Character: Radio - Mike Dunn
44.plot: Saint Louis Radio host of "Quest for Character", Mike Dunn sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Dunn talks about his 1 hour Tuesday night radio program based out of Saint Louis Missouri on am 630 KJSL. (Peppers once hosted the longest running radio program at the same station for 10 years) Dunn also talks about the high profile guests including Upcoming radio guest interview with five Emmy Award winner Tim Conway star of The Carol Burnett Show on November 27,2007.

45.title: Theresa Garcia Ministry: Understanding the End of Age
45.plot: Dr.Debra Peppers host of the Outreach Connection program goes on location to her hometown Saint Louis, Missouri. Special guest is her friend Pastor Theresa Garcia host of the TV program ministry "Understanding the End of Age". Part of the discussion are the words of wisdom and elements Theresa talks about on her program like end time events, comparing the Word of God with current events, scientific discoveries and the words of the Jewish sages.

46.title: Tom Waters: Christmas
46.plot: Pastor Tom Waters of "The Song and the Word" TV program sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers. The discussion touches on many topics including Christmas.

47.title: Pro-life, Faith and Freedom
47.plot: Peggy Dresden, Faith & Freedom Family Ministries leader sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers. The discussion touches on many topics including, FFFM electing a seven member Board of Directors In October 2007 to conduct the organizational and business aspects of the ministry. Peggy Dresden is apart of the board of directors as Secretary. The theme of the program is a pro-life discussion.

48.plot:

49.plot:

50.title: Maxine Rice/Bryan Meado: March for Jesus
50.plot: Maxine Rice, Associate Director and Underwriter with WGCA 88.5 Radio and Pastor Bryan Meado from "The Rock" church in Quincy, Illinois sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on her show "Outreach Connection". The topic is the March for Jesus event.

51.title: Carol Means: Quincy C.W. Assoc.
51.plot: Carol Means, Chairman of the "Christian Women Connection" in Quincy Illinois sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on her show "Outreach Connection". Carol Means retired in 2005 from the Adams County Treasurer's Office (Illinois). She studied at Cornerstone University an independent, non-denominational Christian university in Grand Rapids, Michigan.

52.title: Linda Waite: Habitat for humanity
52.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Linda Waite with the Quincy, Illinois Habitat for humanity. The two discuss topics including Thrivent Builds/Habitat Ground Breaking Ceremony which took place Sunday, August 19th 2007 in Mendon, IL. The property is located at 605 South State Road and was donated, in part, by First Bankers Trust and the Mendon Area Economic Development Association. Quincy Area Habitat raised the remaining $5,000.00.

53.title: Doctor Debra Peppers: New Year
53.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers - National Speakers Association, and Hall of fame teacher discusses the new year and scriptures from the bible. No in studio guest.

54.title: Doctor Gary Schluckebier: Addicts Victorious
54.plot: Dr.Debra Peppers and Dr. Gary Schluckebier discuss The Vision for the new Addicts Victorious program from the prior year (2007) The Year of Jubilee. Other topics are also discussed on the Outreach Connection program.

55.title: Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch: Bottle Tabs
55.plot: Dr.Peppers and K. Marshall discuss the Bottle tabs fund-raiser and the prior 10th annual Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch motorcycle run held on November 3, 2007 on the Outreach Connection program.

56.title: Women's Conference
56.plot: Vicki Phillips and Christie Weishaar sit down with Dr.Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The topic is the upcoming women's conference. Other topics focus on "The Sister Circle Nfp " program featured as a non-profit organization with contact Christie Weishaar who resides in Rushville, Illinois.

57.title: Doctor Debra Peppers: Herself
57.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers - National Speakers Association, and Hall of fame teacher goes solo in studio with a discussion towards the viewers. No in-studio guest.

58.title: Led New Community Outreach Program
58.plot: President Rev. Denette McCombs and Vice President Donna Wittich of the "Led New Community Outreach Program" sit down with Dr.Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The topic is the new program entitled "Led New" is intended to minister to the families left behind by those incarcerated. Through the program, families of prisoners can receive food, household items, office supplies, school supplies, and more.

59.title: Hope for Healing
59.plot: Kirsten Hildahl-Dewey, president of Hope for Healing and Carolyn Kling, "The Prayer Lady" sit down with Dr.Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The topic is the organization called Hope for Healing who along with Missouri Kids First are set to bring Marilyn Van Derbur former Miss America in 1958 to Hannibal, Missouri to share her story first-hand childhood sexual abuse among other topics.

60.title: Addicts Victorious: Conference
60.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show with friends from the "Addicts Victorious" program Jerry Jenkins and Gary Schluckebier. Rev. Dr. Gary E. Schluckebier Associate Director of Biblical Counseling and Rev. Jerald F. Jenkins the Executive Director of Addicts Victorious discuss "A Life-Changing Experience" Conference.

61.title: Blessing Hospital Chaplains' Program
61.plot: Reverend Dan Brothers, lead chaplain at Blessing Hospital in Quincy, Illinois appears on the Outreach Connection program taped at WTJR-TV in an interview with Debra Peppers. There are currently about 40 local pastors active in the Chaplains Program, mostly from the immediate Quincy area, but there are some, according to Brothers, who travel from as far away as Carthage and Ewing, Missouri. Brothers states most of the pastors involved are of the Protestant faith, but there are four Roman Catholic priests on call as needed.

62.title: Watching Judas: Christian Music Group
62.plot: "Watching Judas" a young Christian music group appeared on the Outreach Connection program taped at WTJR-TV in an interview with Debra Peppers. Several band members of the Saint Louis, Missouri based group including Eric and Christian Barfield discuss vocals, using keyboards, and musical influences. Label Management: Listening House Records.

63.title: Jail Ministry for Jesus
63.plot: Pastor Wendell McCombs from "Jail Ministries for Jesus" is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Among other topics Dr. Peppers and the pastor discuss the opening process of a new training center and branch office in Mendon. The training center is only one-half of a building donated to the organization by a private citizen for the works of Christ. The major component of this building will be the "Led New Community Outreach Program", led by President Rev. Denette McCombs of La Harpe and Vice President Donna Wittich of Carthage. This ...

64.title: Community for His Heart Ministries
64.plot: Pastor Wendell McCombs from "Jail Ministries for Jesus" along with Mike Floyd from "Community for his heart ministries" are interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Among other topics Dr. Peppers and Pastor McCombs talk about the JMJ organization recently receiving a presidential accommodation from President Bush for "reaching out to the community through serving others in need" in August of 2007.

65.title: Bruce Rice/Dixie Forte: National Day of Prayer
65.plot: Bruce Rice - Executive Director WGCA Radio and Dixie Forte - Director for the Monthly National Day of Prayer are interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Bruce Rice who is also president of the Christian Ministers Fellowship states "Our city leaders have always valued the importance of prayer and the place it holds in our community,". Local pastors and civic leaders always gather at two sites on the day to pray for their community that will provide an accent to National Day of Prayer. Further discussion of the annual Mayor's Breakfast at 7 ...

66.title: MADD: Jody Bogue
66.plot: Addiction Psychiatrist Jody Bogue is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Jody Bogue, who has served terms as vice president and president of the Quincy Illinois Mothers Against Drunk Driving chapter (MADD). Jody Bogue is the 2008 recipient of the Adams County (Illinois) Bar Association's Liberty Bell Award as she discusses this and the Law Day luncheon. Dr. Peppers and Bogue also discuss how she has been in a wheelchair since a 1991 traffic crash when she was in a vehicle and hit by a drunken driver. Bogue has participated in more than...

67.title: Concerned Women for America: Gloria Hodges
67.plot: New Prayer Action Chapter Leader (PAL), Gloria Hodges sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Hodges talks about holding her first meeting last March (2007) with Concerned Women for America among other topics.

68.title: The Power of Love: Robert Ernest Price
68.plot: Robert Ernest Price, Author of the newly published book "The Power Of Love" sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Tate Publishing & Enterprises publisher of the book has the book available on several websites and some bookstores.

69.title: Right to Life: Sharon Lunt
69.plot: Sharon Lunt with Right to Life of Adams County Illinois sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. A fund-raiser event Garage sale is also a topic discussed.

70.title: James Moffett: a Missionary/Evangelist to China
70.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Reverend James Moffett a missionary/evangelist and founder of The World for Christ. Moffett has been a missionary living in Mainland China for 13 years. He has taught in Chinese schools, started his own underground Church, as well as "The World for Christ" Bible College in Mainland China. He is also a gifted speaker and song writer.

71.title: Senior Luncheons: Pastor Tom Waters
71.plot: Abundant Life Ministries Evangelist Tom Waters sits down with Dr. Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The pastor is present to talk about senior luncheons and the benefits it has to the local communities. Tom is also host of the Christian Television network affiliate Program "The Song and The WORD" produced at WTJR Studio where Outreach Connection is also produced. Pastor Tom Waters is also the longest running Camera Operator for the Outreach Connection program and light-heartedly plays the piano for Dr. Peppers and Donette Douglas to sing, while behind the ...

72.title: Biblical Counseling: Addicts Victorious
72.plot: The topic Addicts Victorious from a Godly perspective is conveyed along with the 5-Day Biblical Counseling Program between guest Gary Schluckebier and host Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Reverend Dr. Gary E. Schluckebier Associate Director of Biblical Counseling would make several appearances in the upcoming seasons on Outreach Connection following up on the addicts victorious program and Veterans Victorious. Veterans Victorious is a program of Addicts Victorious International Ministries and is an all inclusive outreach to those men and women ...

73.title: Freedom: Debra Peppers
73.plot: The topic Freedom for Independence day from a Godly perspective is conveyed with host Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

74.title: Jesus Project: Ramona Wink
74.plot: Ramona a Billy Graham Ambassador and soon to be host of her own TV Program sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the outreach connection program. Ramona Wink is the Iowa Ambassador for the JESUS Name Project . That ministry's mission is "To boldly publish the Name of Jesus with dignity and simplicity worldwide. Known by many as the highway billboard signs that simply say "Jesus" in capital letters.

75.title: Healing Testimony from Colon Cancer
75.plot: Winford and Wilma Vaughn owners of Rabbit Ridge Rentals in Edina, Missouri discuss their story of healing from colon cancer as a result of faith in God. Dr. Peppers discusses this topic and prayer on the Outreach Connection program.

76.title: Gospel Shed
76.plot: Marty and Betty Miller of The Gospel Shed in Hannibal Missouri discuss "The Gospel Shed" with Dr. Peppers on the outreach connection program. Marty and Betty Miller state their intention with The Gospel Shed is to share our love for God with as many people as we can till' Jesus comes. The Gospel Shed was nothing more than an old machine shed until work began in the spring of 2005 to transform it into a gospel music theatre and a meeting place for bible study and prayer groups and banquets. Featuring Worship services, Gospel Music Concerts, and live Southern Gospel ...

77.title: Bernice Vinson: Lamb's Ministries
77.plot: Bernice Vinson from "Lamb's Ministries" in Keokuk, Iowa sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

78.title: Randy Peterson of Quincy Christian School
78.plot: Randy Peterson, the first-year head administrator of Quincy Christian School (Quincy Illinois), sits down with Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The discussion touches on a new kind of fund-raiser among other topics.

79.title: WGCA Radio: Laura Cook and Esther Browning
79.plot: Laura Cook from WGCA radio in Quincy, Illinois and Esther Browning sit down with Dr.Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program.

80.title: Collecting Pop Tabs for Children's home
80.plot: Dr.Debra Peppers sits down with Breana, 7 years old, who is collecting Pop Tabs for a children's home in Sudan.

81.title: Glory Worship Center: Women's Retreats
81.plot: "Outreach Connection" Television host Dr. Debra Peppers sits sown with guest Barb Schreacke from Glory Worship Center in Clayton Illinois for the upcoming Women's retreats. Barb would appear again with Dr. Peppers the following year in 2009 to discuss the yearly event.

82.title: Maxine Rice (WGCA Radio)/Steve Hill (The Truth Project)
82.plot: Maxine Rice, Associate Director and Underwriter with WGCA 88.5 Radio discusses Steve Hill (The Truth Project) with Dr.Peppers on the outreach connection program.

83.title: Amy Schmiedeskamp: Young Lives
83.plot: Amy Schmiedeskamp discusses her role and what the local ministry does with Dr.Peppers on the outreach connection program. Cross Over Youth Ministry impacting teens in Quincy Illinois and the surrounding areas. Amy's involvement is also in the Shepherding group ministry which offers a closer study of God's Word in a small environment. Primarily she discusses the young lives ministry named "Cross Over Youth Ministry" which uses tools like Bible-based lessons, activities, trips and dialog. The purpose of this ministry is to encourage teens to see the value of God's word,...

84.title: Jeana Luttrull - Egypt Missions

86.title: Kent and Jeremiah Lewis - Mission Hill Baptist Church and Christian Academy

87.title: The Isaacs - Concert
87.plot: Pastor Ken Geisendorfer and Pastor Michael Wortman from KJIR radio sit down with Debra Peppers to discuss the "THE ISAACS" - Concert at the Gaither Family Resources Fall Festival on October 3, 2008. "THE ISAACS" have received a Grammy Nomination for Bluegrass Album " A Gospel Gathering featuring Ralph Stanley and The Isaacs" and are also three time Dove Award nominees winning one in 1997.

88.title: Pastor and Author - Thad Carter
88.plot: Pastor and Author Thad H. Carter sits down with Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program to discuss his book "Download Faith not Fear" Released the previous year in 2007. Carter has also authored two other books starting in 2005 with the book "Rainfall at the Charleston Hotel" and later after this program aired he finalized and released "Peeking over the Edge".

89.title: Tri State family Services
89.plot: Sherry Bliss with Tri State Family Services in Carthage, Illinois sits down with Debra Peppers on Outreach connection. This is Sherry's first appearance on Outreach connection with Debra Peppers.

90.title: Pastor Charles Sharpe - Heartland ministries

92.title: Leisha Kelly - Children's Author
92.plot: Leisha Kelly, children's Author, sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Christian Television network program "Outreach Connection".

93.title: Corrine Freier - Home Schooling support group
93.plot: Corrine Freier - Springfield Homeschooling Examiner from Springfield Illinois sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Christian Television network program "Outreach connection".

94.title: HUGS (Hearts United in God's Service)
94.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

95.title: Joseph Pashka - Author
95.plot: Author Joseph Pashka sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection"Joseph Pashka is the Author of the book titled "The Aramaic Gospels and Acts".

96.title: Father Payne - Right to Life
96.plot: Father Lewis A. Payne impressed the cast and crew prior to filming the Outreach Connection television episode with Dr. Debra Peppers with his piano playing. Father Payne was representing the Adams County Illinois Right To Life program. he is the Reverend of St Clare, Diocese of Quincy, TEC in Rushville Illinois.

97.title: Soup Kitchen - Community Outreach
97.plot: Father Derbyshire and Dr. Bill Barker sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection" Dr. Bill Barker is the Executive Director of Horizons Social Services of Adams County, Inc. He and his wife Sara have one son, Aidin. The Barker Family worships at LifePoint Bible Church. In his work for Horizons, Bill oversees the strategic planning, fund-raising, grant-writing, staff oversight and management, and the networking and recruiting of area churches and volunteers. Reverend Bill Barker also takes the time to greet each and every person coming in during the ...

98.title: Laura Willing - Care Net Pregnancy Services
98.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

99.title: Alex Brandenburg - Fellowship of Christian Athletes
99.plot: Alex Brandenburg from Palmyra Missouri sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection". Alex is a Men's Golf athlete at Hannibal-LaGrange College and discusses the Fellowship of Christian Athletes.

100.title: Debra Peppers and Donette Douglas- 100th Show celebration
100.plot: Christian Television Network surprised Dr. Peppers with a certificate for her 100th show. Director / Producer and also Local WTJR TV Station manager Donette Douglas, would be doing the interviewing this time with Debra Peppers in the hot seat.

101.title: Don Pearce: Christian Motorcyclist Association
101.plot: Don Pearce with the "Christian Motorcyclist Association" sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection" Don Pearce speaks about the "Mississippi Valley Spoke N Word Chapter" in the Quincy Illinois and Hannibal Missouri area as well as the whole cyclist group.

102.title: Phillip Hall: Missionary
102.plot: Missionary from Kahoka Missouri, Phillip Hall sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection".

103.title: Lindell Shumake: Prison Ministry
103.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers host of "Outreach Connection", sits down with JoHanna Schumake and her Father Lindell Schumake. Lindell has gone to the Philippines eighteen times and is planning another trip soon he discusses this as well as the prison and jail ministry calling he has done since 1976. Lindell Shumake would appear later in the season during an August program alongside Andrew Pham to discuss his Vietnam mission trips and serving in the U.S. army.

104.title: Bajo Jecminica: 'Reason for Hope' Ministries
104.plot: Bajo Jecminica - "Reason For Hope" ministries from Cameron, Missouri sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach connection program. A few months after the television program was aired Bajo passed away on August 2, 2009. Bajo tells his story when he was 22 years old he was forced to leave Yugoslavia due to a federal judge who ordered him to leave and never return. He states "The reason for his doing this was because I was adamant that communism was an evil system. In 1969, I set out for the United States of America and settled in Cleveland, Ohio, where I lived ...

105.title: Dick and Christine Stuart: Rejection and the Christian Path of Life
105.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Dick Stuart and Christine his wife who will be starting a new show on the Christian Television Network Affiliate WTJR in March 2009. It will be called "Path of Life" and talking about rejection and how to handle it and how the Christian should love those who have been through it.

106.title: Teresa Taylor and Janet Veach: Alzheimer's Association
106.plot: Janet Veach: Director of Public Relations and Teresa Taylor from the Quincy Illinois area Alzheimer's Association sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program. The Alzheimer's Association's annual Memory Walk The winning nursing home receives a traveling trophy to keep for a year. After the episode aired it was learned that The defending champ is Sunset Home, which raised $2,218 in 2009. That figure was part of the $30,753 raised toward programs and materials the Quincy Area Branch provides for the five-county area it covers. Caregivers and ...

107.title: Rev. Jerald Jenkins: Addicts Victorious
107.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Rev. Jerald F. Jenkins the Executive Director of Addicts Victorious. Jerry Jenkins is a guest on the Outreach Connection program to discuss helping people overcome their everyday problems, fears, and addictive behaviors. This is done through the use of support group meetings, a 5-day Biblical counseling program, and individual counseling. Also support for addictions to alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, gambling, sexual/pornography, and smoking. Jerald Jenkins would appear again the following year with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach ...

108.title: Healed of Cancer: Testimony
108.plot: Debra Peppers interviews WTJR - Christian Television Network Production Assistant Don Russell who has worked with the Outreach Connection program since inception. Don Russell gives his testimony on being healed of Cancer and how Christ healed the disease from his body, a modern day miracle.

109.title: Reverend Robert D. Vanden Bosch
109.plot: Discussion is over the topic of Lobbying the Illinois State Government on behalf of the Christian Community. Reverend Robert D. Vanden Bosch is interviewed by Debra Peppers on the Christian Television network program "Outreach Connection". Since 1993 Vanden Bosch has served as a lobbyist on behalf of Illinois' Christians, standing for traditional values in Springfield, Illinois. Because our culture puts tremendous pressure on the practice of Christianity, his ministry is more necessary than ever. Rev. Vanden Bosch ministers as a missionary sent out by his home church,...

110.title: Dixie Forte: National day of Prayer 2009
110.plot: Around 15 different Hannibal churches and numerous people will gather together for National Day of Prayer... it is an annual day of observance held yearly. Discussion is about the Thursday May 7,2009 Day of Prayer, designated by the United States Congress, as Hannibal Missouri residents come together for National Day of Prayer. This topic is discussed by Dr. Debra Peppers as she interviews Director Dixie Forte on the Christian Television network program "Outreach Connection". Dixie Forte would appear again the following year with Debra Peppers in an Apr 2010 interview...

111.title: Evangelist Robert Newton: Tent Revivals
111.plot: Evangelist Robert Newton sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program. Discussion is over the previous weekend of May 8, 2009 Blessing Heights Church of God revival with Robert and his wife Stephanie Newton for the Friday, Saturday, and Sunday event Organized by Tim Smith. Evangelist Newton discusses in detail the upcoming event on May 18, 2009 through May 22, 2009 FULL GOSPEL Church Tent Revival in Quincy, IL. The speakers will be pastor Williams and Evangelist Robert Newton himself.

112.title: Dale and Pearl Raatz: Final Word Ministries
112.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Dale and Pearl Raatz with Final Word Ministries. Dale and Pearl Raatz have been traveling pastors since 1971. Pioneering New Life Christian Fellowship Center in Wausaukee, Wisconsin in 1977. Dale and Pearl wrote about their experience in their book "The God of Now." They currently travel around the world teaching others "how to live and not die," as well as how to overcome in every situation of life through faith in God's anointed Word the Bible.

113.title: Ronica Stromberg: Author
113.plot: Author Ronica Stromberg sits down with Doctor Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program. Discussion is primarily set about her recent book published titled "The Time-for-Bed Angel" published on September 30,2008 from Lion Publishing. Ronica Stromberg is the author of two young adult novels, "A Shadow in the Dark" and "Living It Up to Live It Down"; a tween mystery, "The Glass Inheritance"; and a picture book, "The Time-for-bed Angel." Her short stories appear in eighteen anthologies and various inspirational magazines.

114.title: Jeff Steinkamp: Chairman, 'Addicts Victorious'
114.plot: Jeff Steinkamp, city engineer for Quincy, IL, and chairman of the board for Addicts Victorious" sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Jeff Volunteers his time and efforts to Addicts Victorious. The program helps individuals have the desire to engage in addictive behavior completely removed.

115.title: Hand in Hand Widows Ministry
115.plot: Wanda Toppe and Mary Hendrickson from Hand in Hand Widows Ministry sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program.

116.title: Sole Sisters: The Kenya Shoe Project
116.plot: George Hutchings "shoe man", Sherri White, and Carolyn May the sole sisters from the Kenya Shoe Project sit down together with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program Carolyn May, one of the Sole Sisters, said that she was inspired by Hutchings to collect shoes because she wanted to spread her faith while Helping those in need. A celebration for the effort was discussed to the upcoming event at Illinois Community Park in Pleasant Hill, hosted by the Sole Sisters and Shoeman Water Projects.

117.title: Boyd Halford: Founder, Camp Victory
117.plot: Evangelist Boyd Halford sits down with host Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. God called him into the ministry of the Gospel at the age of 18, while still in high school. It was at this time that he acquired the name "The Timothy of The Ozarks". Boyd Halford founded Camp Victory in Northeast Missouri in the Fall of 1968. He is a musician, composer, and author. He has recorded several albums and for several years carried on a radio and TV ministry.

118.title: Michelle Tournear: Christian Romance Author
118.plot: Michelle Tournear sits down with host Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Michelle Tournear is a Christian romance author of two books and a learning disabilities teacher in Quincy Illinois. She authored "Promise of the Heart" published by Deep River in February 2007 and Aqua Blue published by Tate Publishing & Enterprises in June 2009.

119.title: Daniel Bock: Heartland Ministries
119.plot: Daniel Bock from Heartland Ministries also known as C.N.S. International Ministries near Newark, Missouri sits down with host Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program. Dan Bock from Heartland discusses the support and upcoming Midwest event on July 3 and 4 2009 called "Charlie's Holiday" Heartland Community and Ozark are celebrating 45 years of helping people celebrate financial security finding a new life in God and a fresh start. "Charlie's Holiday" is an expansion of the annual Heartland Open house normally held in October. Heartland Academy Community ...

120.title: Christian Prison Ministry
120.plot: Pastor Wendell McCombs from Burlington Iowa Jail Ministry for Jesus and Mark Wheeler from Harmony Baptist association Ministries sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach connection program. Jail Ministry for Jesus or JMJ, was co-founded in 2002, and is a non-profit interdenominational organization benefiting the "lost world of the incarcerated and their families". Co-founders are Pastor Wendell and Rev. Denette McCombs of La Harpe. The organization specializes in serving county jails and prisons through ministry, training and licensing people. It currently ...

121.title: Relevant Practical Ministry for Men
121.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers and guest Tom Cheshire from Springfield, Illinois discuss His ministry "Relevant Practical Ministry For Men" Tom Cheshire is the Lead Servant working with Jan Cheshire his wife. Tom served in the United States Marines from 1976-1980 beginning a career in corporate aviation from 1980 until 2002. Tom has been in men's ministry really all his life, but has been in leadership in both his church as the lay men's leader and in the Springfield and Central IL community for over a decade. Tom is a field trainer for man In The Mirror; Men's Ministry Coach for ...

122.title: Le Masters Hope Foundation: Scott and Marcy LeMasters
122.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers and guest missionaries Scott and Marcy Le Masters along with their sons John and Isaiah appeared on the TV Program. Scott and Marcy are working in Asia with their family. Scott and Marcy would make another appearance on the program Outreach Connection in a 2010 season episode titled "Le Masters Hope Foundation - Missions".

123.title: Chaddock: Every Child Deserves a Chance
123.plot: Karen Buckwalter and Angel Knoverek came representing "Chaddock", a home for children with problems that is faith based from here in Quincy, Illinois. They appeared on the "Outreach Connection" show with Dr. Debra Peppers. Chaddock is on the cutting edge of residential treatment for children who have experienced severe abuse, neglect, or other trauma in their early years of development, and is nationally-respected for the excellent results demonstrated in our Developmental Trauma and Attachment Program (DTAP). Many of the children in this program are adopted by loving...

124.title: Tass Abu Saada: Author
124.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show sits down with Author Tass Abu Saada. Tass Abu Saada was born a Muslum but now serves Jesus. He has written a book called "Born To Kill Jews". Tass Abu Saada, also authored the book "Once An Arafat Man", he used to believe that a good Jew was a dead Jew. His hatred was so strong he dreamed of poisoning Jews who frequented the restaurant where he worked. In 1974, Tass came to the United States. He found Americans generally to be loving and caring, completely opposite of what he had been taught, so he decided to ...

125.title: Carol Means: Chairman, Christian Women Connection
125.plot: Carol Means, Chairman of the "Christian Women Connection" in Quincy Illinois was with Dr. Debra Peppers.

126.title: Pastors Andrew Pham and Lindell Shumake
126.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show sits down with Pastor Schumake from Hannibal Missouri and Pastor Pham with a church in Chicago Illinois who worked together in Vietnam. Lindell Shumake and his wife named Lydia and two daughters Johanna and Lizzie. He was ordained to the gospel ministry in 1974 and has spent a good portion of his life doing the Lord's work also leaving home in 1969 to go to Vietnam serving in the U.S. army. Lindell has been on 19 mission trips to the Philippines and other Asian countries. Also, we went to China 9 years ago to ...

127.title: Hezekiah Elgin House
127.plot: Richard Cottrell from Clarksville Missouri sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" show. Richard is the owner of one of the oldest houses on record in Missouri's river front town Clarksville. Richard also an artist and avid antique collector is now in the process of undertaking the task of restoring the Hezekiah Elgin House. The Hezekiah Elgin House History starts with The Elgin family in Pike County when William Elgin bought a 3,000-acre Spanish Tract in 1816. He opened a trading post and built one of the first roads between St. Louis and ...

128.title: Loaves and Fishes: Ronn Pashia
128.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show with her friend from the Loaves and Fishes program pastor Ronn Pashia who directs the program. The Reverend sits down for an interview to discuss the not-for-profit program that just started its 11th year with a larger number of hungry people to feed and a drop in the donations of food and money that make it all possible. Pastor Pashia says "We're serving 100 people a night" and his ultimate goal is to open a homeless shelter and kitchen. That would also enable the program to receive bulk food from the Missouri...

129.title: Deb Bowen: Holocaust Literacy Project
129.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers Television host for "Outreach Connection" sits down with Deb Bowen of Aledo Illinois began a Holocaust literacy project in the Quad Cities in 2002. The vision began when she met three Jewish survivors from the area - each named Esther. To keep their stories alive, she networked with the Jewish Federation of the Quad Cities, the Midwest Writing Center and area teachers. Survivors spoke in schools and students were asked to write and illustrate the story in a simple children's story book form. Deb is a writer and active member of the Quad Cities ...

130.title: Kenya Shoe Project
130.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers Television host for "Outreach Connection" sits down with the Soul Sisters Carolyn May, Sherri White and her daughter Carley White. Carolyn May, one of the Sole Sisters, said that she was inspired by George Hutchings to collect shoes because she wanted to spread her faith while helping those in need.

131.title: E.L. Warren Ministries
131.plot: "Outreach Connection" Television host Dr. Debra Peppers sits sown with guest Bishop E.L. Warren. Bishop Warren is a member of the International Communion of Charismatic Churches. The unique Ministry of Bishop Warren and Lady Ella Warren is currently nurturing over 52 other Ministries in the United States and Nations abroad via the International Network of Affiliate Ministries. THE CHRISTIAN DEGREE PROGRAMS OF LIFE CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY are designed to equip students to follow the Lord in the work of the ministry. LCU is accredited through Trans-world Accrediting ...

132.title: Glory Worship Center
132.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with guest Barb Schreacke from Glory Worship Center in Clayton Illinois for the upcoming Women's retreats.

133.title: Patty Bolton: Christmas Shoe Boxes
133.plot: "Outreach Connection" Television host Dr. Debra Peppers sits sown with guest Patty Bolton who works with the Christmas shoe-boxes. Heart to Heart Community Outreach, Inc. is a 501 (c) 3, non-profit corporation providing service to those in need. Chartered in 2009, Heart to Heart Community Outreach, Inc. is supported by churches, businesses, community groups, and individuals in local communities of Pike County. The people that Heart to Heart Community Outreach helps are families, individuals, single parents, children, and the elderly, all who may be living on fixed ...

134.title: Well House Ministries
134.plot: Betty Kaufman and Amber McGinnis from Well house ministries sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers.

135.title: Moms in Touch
135.plot: Priscilla Long from Moms in Touch sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" show. Moms In Touch International is Two or more moms who meet regularly to pray for their children, their schools, their teachers and administrators. Also Mothers, grandmothers or anyone who is willing to pray for a specific child and school are welcome to participate. Moms In Touch A nonprofit, donation-supported ministry in 120-plus countries.

136.title: Mark Tanner: Musician
136.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show with friends Mark Tanner and his wife Suzanne. Mark Tanner states God can turn your misery into a ministry giving a testimony. Mark brings his 6 string Cutaway dreadnought guitar on the set with Dr. Peppers and performs the song titled "When I think of you Lord" Suzanne from Switzerland gives her testimony of coming to Christ at the age of 35 through her Boss' influence and a broken relationship. Musician Mark Tanner and his wife Suzanne from New Heart Ministries would appear later in the Outreach Connection TV...

137.title: 'Veterans Victorious' Program
137.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show with friends from the "Veterans Victorious " program Rick Haynes and Gary Schluckebier. Reverend Dr. Gary E. Schluckebier Associate Director of Biblical Counseling would appear later in the next season of the Outreach Connection program titled "Addicts Victorious" program. Veterans Victorious is a program of Addicts Victorious International Ministries is an all inclusive outreach to those men and women from all ranks and branches of service - Air Force, Army, Marines, Navy, US Coast Guard and Merchant Marine. ...

138.title: Machine Gun Preacher: Sam Childers
138.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers had the "Machine Gun Preacher" as a guest on the "Outreach Connection" show along with his helper Chris. Sam Childers rescues children abducted in Southern Sudan and Northern Uganda from the Lord's Resistance Army. He has also written a book called "Another Mans War". Sam Childers is a former drug dealing gang biker who dedicated his life and resources to rescue children in the war zone of Sudan. Childers and his wife Lynn founded and operate Angels of East Africa, the Children's Village Orphanage in Nimule, Sudan, where they currently have more than...

139.title: Stoney Ferguson: Musician
139.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show interviews Musician and guitarist Stoney Ferguson. Stoney Ferguson is also from St. Louis, Missouri like Dr. Peppers and is beginning his own Television program ministry on the Christian Television Network affiliate in Quincy Illinois titled "Open Heaven". "Open Heaven" with Pastor Mark and Jill Sheppard also features Pastor Stoney Ferguson and his music ministry. Stoney brings his 6 string Cutaway dreadnought guitar on the set with Dr. Peppers and plays her a song during the later part of the program. He has ...

140.title: Exercising Spiritual Authority
140.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show interviews Mike and Jackie Schaffer who were talking about "Exercising Spiritual Authority" for a conference held in Quincy, Illinois.

141.title: The Chosen Ones
141.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show interviews "The Chosen Ones" group from Manchester Illinois. Gracen is the newest member of the group, Debra Encourages Gracen to sing live. Their parents who are part of the group were not able to attend the filming. Band members present are Tressa Rueter, Brady Rueter, Mariah Lomelino with Gracen on his Mother's lap. Gracen blessed us with a song and so did the adults singing uplifting Southern Gospel music. The family performs over 160 concerts a year and travel thousands of miles across the United States ...

142.title: Russell Waugh: Testimony
142.plot: Russell Waugh and his wife Debbie sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on "Outreach Connection" - The Waugh's are with the "Olive Tree Outreach Inc." ministry. Russell gives his chilling testimony of being abused as a young child and overcoming that obstacle. Russell and Debbie would later appear in another interview on the "Outreach Connection" program the following year.

143.title: Wanda Davis: Aglow International
143.plot: Wanda Davis sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" program Wanda Davis graduated Magna Cum Laude with a BS in Psychology from Liberty University in Lynchburg, Virginia Wanda is Public Relations Officer for Aglow International in St. Louis, Missouri. She participates as a lay counselor at her church.

144.title: J. J. Woods: Author, The Forgotten Covenant
144.plot: J. J. Woods - Author - "The Forgotten Covenant: God's Key to an Abundant Life" sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" TV program. If you are serious about pursuing or renewing your personal relationship with God, put aside your "religiosity" and experience The Forgotten Covenant.

145.title: Jeanne Mohr: Author, Living Praise Ministries
145.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with author Jeanne Mohr, she has authored 5 books titled "BattlePlan", "And the Beat Goes On", "All That Glitters", "Put Down Your Anchor Ride Out the Storm", and "Absolutely". She has just completed the filming of a Musical "The Journey" and looks forward to releasing it to the public in the near future. Her "Lets Write for Jesus" Workshop inspires others to get their testimonies and books into print. Jeanne directs Living Praise Ministries in High Ridge, Missouri.

146.title: Mary Jo Schneller: Spiritual Warfare
146.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with Mary Jo Schneller, Ph.D. She is the founder and director of South County Christian Counseling Center in St. Louis, Missouri. She is actively educating churches and the public in the subjects of abuse and trauma. Mary Jo has a Master's of Arts in Clinical Christian Counseling, and has earned a Doctorate in Psychology from Cornerstone University. For the past sixteen years Mary Jo has been working with people who suffer from sexual abuse, depression, and anxiety disorders, as well as personality disorders. Mary Jo has put together a ...

147.title: Ed Alms: Family Life Marriage Seminar
147.plot: Dr. Peppers sits down with Ed Alms who is promoting the Family Life Marriage Seminar in Hannibal Missouri on February 26 and 27th 2010. Ed conveys that this event is to help with a number of topics primarily communication in your marriage.

148.title: New Start Rescue Mission
148.plot: Dr. Peppers sits down with Mark Dedert, board chairman and Pastor Rod Bakker of Faith Presbyterian Church who also works with "New Start Rescue Mission" in Quincy, Illinois. The Rescue Mission is a group that helps homeless men in this area. At this time they are praying for funds to redo the upstairs of the building since the need is so great. On Wednesday Oct 14, 2009 just a few months prior to their appearance on the "Outreach Connection" program the Founder of New Start Rescue Mission Chuck Smith found dead in lake in Shelby County, Missouri.

149.title: Michelle Kasparie: Blessing Hospital
149.plot: Michelle Kasparie from Blessing Hospital in Quincy, Illinois sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers to discuss the Share and Heal programs that are available through the Blessings Hospital. Michelle Kasperie spoke about the programs HEAL (Helping Every Adult with Loss) is a grief support group that offers friendship and understanding for adults who have lost a spouse, close relative or friend. The support group "HEAL "meets the third Tuesday of each month at 7:00pm. For more information the contact is Rev. Dan Brothers, lead chaplain, at (217) 223-8400, ext. 6823

150.title: 'Addicts Victorious' Program
150.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers, host of the "Outreach Connection" show with friends from the "Addicts Victorious" program Jerry Jenkins and Gary Schluckebier. Rev. Dr. Gary E. Schluckebier Associate Director of Biblical Counseling and Rev. Jerald F. Jenkins the Executive Director of Addicts Victorious discuss helping people overcome their everyday problems, fears, and addictive behaviors. This is done through the use of support group meetings, a 5-day Biblical counseling program, and individual counseling. Also support for addictions to alcohol, drugs, eating disorders, gambling, ...

151.title: Le Masters Hope Foundation: Missions
151.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers interviews Founders, V. Scott & Marcy G. Lemasters of the Le Masters Hope Foundation a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization founded in July of 2009 for the purpose of fulfilling the call laid out in Luke 4:18-19. The topic is their upcoming Missions trip to Thailand in March 2010. Scott & Marcy G. Lemasters discuss their past and present Missionary work in Asian countries.

152.title: Major Alan D. Wurtz: Salvation Army
152.plot: Major Alan D. Wurtz Quincy S.A. EDS Director from Salvation Army is Debra Pepper's Guest. The Salvation Army in Quincy, Illinois serves four counties in Illinois. Dr Debra Peppers spoke with Wurtz about their setup in Haiti and the progress on the Kroc Corps Community Center we have been blessed to have being built in Quincy.

153.title: Dixie Koch, President, Children Are People, Inc.
153.plot: Dixie Koch, President, Children Are People, Inc. and a missionary to Africa is Doctor Debra Peppers guest. Dixie tells the story of 2007 when God spoke to the hearts of a group of friends while on a mission trip in Africa. It became clear that the time is now to mobilize many people who care about the children of the world. The mission is to endeavor to provide food, shelter, medical care and education to children in need. Join with us to help make a life and death difference in the lives of children!

154.title: Pollee Freier: Author
154.plot: Pollee Freier author of a book called "Snickers, The Preacher Cat" published by iUniverse, Incorporated in Nov 2009. Pollee discusses her book and gives the synopsis. While Snickers is writing her advice for cat staffers and aides, she finds herself embroiled in what looks like a plot to kidnap cats in the neighborhood. She organizes the Pet Club, which involves a way to warn pets of impending danger. She soon discovers that one cat is plotting to replace her as the leader, so she must act fast to stop rebellion in the ranks! And all of this is going on while Snickers...

155.title: Sherry Bliss: Chrysalis Shepherding Home
155.plot: Sherry Bliss, Executive director of Tri-State family Service worked with a board to plan the concept of the Chrysalis Shepherding Home, in an effort to find and renovate a house in rural Hancock County Illinois near Adrian, and develop a program to help the residents. Sherry sought after hours of volunteer time and donations of furnishings and money, the home is complete. A chrysalis is a cocoon, the last stage of development before a butterfly emerges. The services center is located in Carthage, IL and is an effort by the Tri-State Family Services to provide a place ...

156.title: Jay Craig: Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch
156.plot: Jay Craig, Stewardship Director at Shiloh Christian Children's Ranch sat down with Dr. Debra Peppers and discussed his role with the Children's ranch. Jay often does a show and tell to churches, and other organizations, about how they provide homes for formerly abused / neglected children.

157.title: Jaime Havens: Evangelist and Missionary
157.plot: Jaime Havens Evangelist and Missionary from Pittsfield, Illinois sat down with Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection show. Jaime and his wife Rachel have two sons, Blake and Michael and are missionaries in Africa and India. New Beginnings International Ministries is established as a 501(c)(3) tax exempt charitable corporation. Jaime explains the Ministry is growing, it is our heart's passion and desire to partner with other ministries in their efforts to bring the Gospel message of salvation and healing to those in need. Over the past years, we have given to church...

158.title: Dixie Forte: National Day of Prayer
158.plot: Around 15 different Hannibal churches and numerous people will gather together for National Day of Prayer... it is an annual day of observance held on the first Thursday of May, designated by the United States Congress, as Hannibal Missouri residents come together for National Day of Prayer. This topic is discussed by Dr. Debra Peppers as she interviews Director Dixie Forte on the Christian Television network program "Outreach Connection" Shortly after this episode aired Hannibal, MO Mayor Roy Hark presented a framed proclamation to Director Dixie Forte and the ...

159.title: Steve Eighinger: Reporter and Faith Page Writer
159.plot: Steve Eighinger writer for the Quincy Herald Whig newspaper in Quincy, IL sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers to discuss his faith and perspective of a newspaper writer.

160.title: Stuart Kelly: 25 years with Haiti Missions
160.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers guest on the "Outreach Connection" show is Stuart Kelly who was standing outside a building when A major earthquake of magnitude 7 struck south-east of Haiti, on Tuesday January 12, 2009. He has been going to Haiti for 25 years with a mission team to help these people. Stuart Kelly of Hamilton, Ill., and a long- time member of the Ferris Christian Church in Ferris, Ill. flew to Christianville, Haiti as part of a mission team to conduct a conference for the native preachers there. Christianville is a Christian mission in Gressier, Haiti, located about...

161.title: Beth Cornwell: Right to Life Organization
161.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers guest on the "Outreach Connection" show is Beth Cornwell, President of Adams County Right to Life organization. Beth conveys that the main focus has been the abortion controversy; other right to life issues such as abstinence, euthanasia, infanticide and embryonic stem cell research are also of focused on. Right to life does this to educate the public, keeping the pro-life message visible and encouraging people to take action and pray. Right to Life of Adams County Board Meets the 2nd Tuesday of the month at 5:00 pm at the Resource Center in Quincy, ...

162.title: Jim Daniels: Word Ministries
162.plot: Jim Daniels from Word Ministries is Dr. Debra Pepper's Guest on "Outreach Connection" Jim has a book he wrote on anger he discusses also referencing with Debra's Book. WORD Ministries is a Locally WTJR produced half-hour program of teachings from the Word of God with Jim Daniels of Quincy, IL.

163.title: Duke DuVall: Light of the World Ministries
163.plot: Duke DuVall from Light of the World Ministries is Dr. Debra Pepper's guest. Duke is Debra Peppers younger brother and is also a Professional speaker, corporate consultant, and international businessman. Duke conveys Light of the World is a not-for-profit corporation founded in 1993, is an interdenominational Christian organization, evangelical in stance, international in scope and made up of men and women from all walks of life and all denominations who share a common vision and desire...to change the world around them. Through Christ-centered alliances with people in...

164.title: Cindy Winters: Grace and Hope Ministries
164.plot: Cindy Winters of Grace and Hope Ministries sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers. Cindy is the wife of pastor Fred Winters, he was the pastor shot to death Mar 8, 2009 during Sunday services at the First Baptist Church of Maryville, Illinois. Cindy said she forgives the accused gunman, who killed her husband and wishes that he will find peace with God. Cindy conveys the mission at Grace and Hope Ministries is to help others discover God's grace through a personal relationship with Jesus and find lasting hope regardless of whatever tragedy or circumstances experienced in ...

165.title: Brian Stone Ministries
165.plot: Pastor Brian Stone sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers and Co-Host Duke DuVall to discuss his Ministry. Brian conveys to the hosts that he and his wife have a full gospel ministry in Maywood, Missouri that is engaged in changing the world according to a mandate from God: "Touching a city, a nation, a continent for God." Just as the apostle Paul stated in I Corinthians 2:4-5, "My message and my preaching were not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power, so that your faith would not rest on the wisdom of men, but on the power of God,"...

166.title: Ministries: Olive Tree Outreach Inc.
166.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with Debbie Waugh and her husband Russell. They are with Ministries Olive Tree Outreach in Pollock, Missouri.

167.title: Heartland Ministries
167.plot: Daniel Bock and Nada Whitehead from Heartland Ministries also known as C.N.S. International Ministries near Newark, Missouri are guests on Outreach Connection with host Dr. Debra Peppers. Heartland Academy Community Church with pastor Charles Sharpe also has a TV ministry airing on the Christian Television Network Affiliate WTJR in Quincy, IL. Since 1996 Heartland offers schooling through their Heartland Christian Academy it is in the private Christian education category and ranges from pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade. Additionally a two-year Christian College ...

168.title: George Hutchings: Shoeman
168.plot: George Hutchings the shoeman sits down with Dr. Peppers to tell about his work in Haiti and showing the water they have to drink there. Dr. Peppers wants you to know he now accepts high heel shoes. Originally Shoeman Water Projects began purchasing and shipping well drilling rigs to Kenya were droughts and political practices leave people walking miles and miles each day to collect dirty water for their families and livestock to survive. To date Shoeman Water Projects has purchased and shipped four water drilling rigs that have drilled 140 wells serving about 130,000 ...

169.title: Tri-States for Jesus Crusade
169.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers host of the "Outreach Connection" sits down with her guests Pastor Soondrum and Pastor Lindell Schumake crusade chairman. They are promoting the Tri-States for Jesus Crusade. Earlier in April Lindell Shumake announced that he will seek to replace Rachel Bringer as the next 6th District State Representative in Jefferson City, Missouri, Lindell is from Hannibal Missouri and is also president of the God's Harvesters prison ministry and foreign missions. A large tent at Clemens Field is the scene of the Tri-States for Jesus Crusade, which starts Thursday...

170.title: Robin and Landon Shipman: Autism
170.plot: Robin and Landon Shipman are Dr. Debra Peppers' guests on "Outreach Connection" Robin conveys she had never heard the word "autism" before. Landon her firstborn son who is also in the studio was diagnosed with this disorder in 1985 on a cold and rainy day in March. Landon was 3½ years old. Robin states "Our lives changed completely when autism was addressed to us. We all want what's best for our children. When Landon was diagnosed, it was 4 or 5 out of every 10,000. Today we know the diagnosis rate now is 1 in 150."

171.title: Chaddock Children's Foundation
171.plot: Shirley Wingerter foster care/licensing/recruitment manager for Chaddock, Children's Foundation and Doris Durk one of the foster parents for Chaddock sat down with host Dr. Debra Peppers. Chaddock Children's Foundation was established in 1996 as a legally separate not-for-profit organization from Chaddock. All donations received by Chaddock, including bequests and those designated for a restricted purpose, are gifted to the Foundation for investment until needed for current operations or until used for the purpose restricted by donors.

172.title: Arthur 'Flash' Johnson: Olympic Boxer
172.plot: Olympic Boxer and St. Louisan Arthur "Flash" Johnson sat down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach connection program. Johnson also held 7 Golden Glove titles in the light flyweight and flyweight division as an open fighter. He competed as a Flyweight for the United States at the 1988 Seoul Olympic Games. The Arthur Johnson Foundation raises money for college scholarships for high school seniors in the metro-east. Arthur states the foundation hopes to award 10 or 15 next year. We want to help these kids stay off the streets and off drugs. Education is the best way. ...

173.title: Neil and Tiffany Pikulski: Tough Guys Inc.
173.plot: Tough Guys Inc. was showcased on WTJR TV on the Quincy Illinois affiliate of the Christian Television Network. Husband and wife team Neil and Tiffany Pikulski sat down with Dr. Debra Peppers sharing the testimonies and what Tough Guys Inc is all about. Tough Guys Inc. , is a small corporation with a goal of fighting for lives, geared around helping kids. Tough Guys Inc. is a clothing line, fund-raiser company, and character program. Within the corporation there are other divisions, and Tough Girls Inc. is one. Tough Guys Inc. feels that you don't have to be a fighter,...

174.title: Sarah Smith: Singer and Songwriter
174.plot: Sarah Smith from Montrose, Iowa sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers to discuss her new CD. Debra states she has known Sara for 10 years and that she has a beautiful singing voice, Sara has written many of the songs she sings. Sara has written 300 songs in her career.

175.title: Prison Ministries
175.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers host of the "Outreach Connection" show sits down with Larry Thompson and Dennis Mayer, men that give of their time to tell prisoners in Montgomery and Lewis County, Missouri about Jesus.

176.title: Mark Tanner: New Heart Ministries International
176.plot: Musician Mark Tanner and his wife Suzanne from New Heart Ministries International in Ottumwa, Iowa sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" show. Mark Tanner is an accomplished musician and recording artist. Mark has had the great privilege to open twice in concert for Ireland's Robin Mark - Dove Award Winner and Best International Gospel Artist of 2004. Mark also is blessed to have worked with world class violinist Arkadiy Gips from Kiev, Ukraine.

177.title: Brian Carrier: Prayer Box Ministry
177.plot: Brian Carrier from Prayer box ministry in Springfield Illinois sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the "Outreach Connection" program. A white pre-made prayer box card is available to send to the ministry and the person asking for prayer does not have to leave a name or phone number. Volunteers are available to answer the phone and take prayer requests 24 hours a day and seven days a week. Prayer box ministry home is 32 Circle Drive Springfield, IL 62703.

178.title: Linda Mallory: F.L.O. - For Ladies Only
178.plot: Dr. Debra Pepper's guest for the "Outreach Connection" is Linda Mallory. Linda is with the Cathedral of Worship in Quincy, IL. She works with a ministry called F.L.O. meaning "For Ladies Only". Membership is open to the body of Christ, women in the community, hurt women, and women ready to move forward in ministry. Transforming Life Ministries is also her husband Pastors William Mallory's ministry.

179.title: Wendell McCombs: Prison Ministry
179.plot: Pastor Wendell McCombs from Burlington Iowa Jail Ministry for Jesus sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach connection program. Jail Ministry for Jesus or JMJ, was co-founded in 2002, and is a non-profit interdenominational organization benefiting the "lost world of the incarcerated and their families". Co-founders are Pastor Wendell and Rev. Denette McCombs of La Harpe. The organization specializes in serving county jails and prisons through ministry, training and licensing people. It currently serves a tri-state area of Illinois, Iowa, and Missouri with 23 ...

180.title: Heartland Women's Recovery
180.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with Audrey Emerson and Crystal Morris from "Heartland Women's Recovery Center." They gave their testimony and talked about the program. Audrey Emerson holds a Bachelor of Science from Grand Valley State College but her real passion comes from discipling others in a real walk with the God who has restored her life. She oversees the Heartland Women's Recovery Program, teaches in the Bible College and serves on the Heartland worship team. In May of 1995, Heartland was born from that earlier encounter in the middle of Northeast Missouri ...

181.title: Jerry and Karen Cowin: Missionaries to Brazil
181.plot: Pastors Jerry and Karen Cowin - Missionaries to Brazil from Wildwood Missouri sit down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection Program. Pastor Jerry Cowin from Central Baptist Church on North Central Ave in Eureka Missouri talks about his travels in the mission fields and they talk about the loss of their son and how God helped them through it.

182.title: Fall Sharathon: Radio
182.plot: Dr. Debra Peppers sits down with Pastor Ken Geisendorfer and Pastor Michael Wortman from KJIR radio station in Hannibal Missouri, They were talking about their Sharathon coming up in October. KJIR fall sharathon will be October 27 -28, 2010. Stating to viewers "This is your chance to help us continue to broadcast the gospel of Jesus Christ through Southern Gospel Music and Christian Programs." The theme this year is "He is God of Enough" from 1 Kings 17:8-16. Pastor Michael Wortman was one of the first guests to appear on Outreach Connection appearing in the 20th ...

183.title: The Ol' Turkey Hunter
183.plot: Author David Kerr who calls him self The Ol' Turkey Hunter is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Kerr, who bought a farm at twenty-four tells ironically, how this got him off the farm and into many other jobs to help make the farm payments. This diversity of experiences has culminated in writing, his book titled "Tales of the Strange and Wonderful" published June 2010 by Trafford Publishing. Tales of the Strange and Wonderful uncovers some of the strangest and and long-familiar Biblical themes viewed from a different perspective this ...

184.title: Sam Childers: Machine Gun Preacher - Follow-up Interview
184.plot: Author of Another Man's war and now a biopic film coming out about his life Sam Childers, the Machine Gun Preacher returns with a follow-up interview. This is the second appearance of Sam Childers and Chris return on the Outreach Connection program with Dr. Debra Peppers. Childer's a former drug dealer, now a Christian, fights in East Africa to save Children from being killed and mutilated by terrorists.

185.title: Megan Duestehaus: Quanada Food Pantry
185.plot: Megan Duestehaus with Quanada food pantry is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Megan Duestehaus - Quanada food pantry is collecting canned goods to give to the needy call (217)-222-0069. A collection of canned goods for Quanada on our December 6th Christmas Celebration. QUANADA maintains a community food pantry at 27th and Maine in Quincy, Illinois.

186.title: Pastor and Author Thad Carter: New Book 'Jesus and Fear'
186.plot: Pastor and Author Thad H. Carter is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Thad H. Carter is pastor of Shelbina, Missouri United Methodist Church, and author of many faith based books including his latest titled "Jesus and Fear". His book was published in June 2010 by Publish America. Thad H. Carter previously appeared on the program in 2008 to discuss his book "Download Faith not Fear".

187.title: Pat Heck/Pansy Knight: Addicts Victorious
187.plot: Addicts Victorious ladies Pat Heck and Pansy Knight are interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. they give out two important phone numbers for addiction assistance.

188.title: Douglas Gittings: Singer, Songwriter and Survivor of Attempted Murder
188.plot: International singer, songwriter, and guitarist Douglas Gittings is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Douglas tried to take a vacation to relax in historic Clarksville, Missouri, on the Mississippi. The next day he found - and bought - a 150 year old church and began restoration to create the "Missouri Music Hall". Doug spent that winter working on the restoration of the Music Hall, until the spring rains of 2008 brought the flood to Clarksville. The events of the flood would dramatically affect the life of Doug Gittings. Douglas ...

189.title: Leisha Kelly: Author, 'House on Malcolm Street'
189.plot: Leisha Kelly author of the new book "House on Malcolm Street" is interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Kelly who has written several books including JULIA'S HOPE, EMMA'S GIFT, and KATIE'S DREAM talks about her book published in September 2010 by Revell. "House on Malcolm Street" is set in the year 1920. With main character Mother Leah Breckenridge who is desperate to find a way to provide for her young daughter. After the loss of her husband and infant son in an accident, she is angry at God and fearful about the future. Finding refuge ...

190.title: Spiritual Roto Rooters: Suicide Prevention Christian Counselors
190.plot: Bob and Judy Stepanek - Special Christian counseling for teens are interviewed by Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. Judy who is an ordained minister and a board certified Christian Counselor, wants to speak to those at risk teenagers, those who are contemplating suicide as a way to solve problems, stating "you have other options." The counselors go on to say they confront the problems head-on! Otherwise known as the "BULL DOG" approach... I have a "BULL DOG" tenacity and will not give up on the cries for help.

191.title: Mark Tanner and Son: Musician
191.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

192.title: Dawn Schiebner: Salvation Army
192.plot: Dawn Schiebrer who works with Salvation Army Food Pantry sits down with Dr. Debra Peppers on the Outreach Connection program. The primary topics are about donation request that are growing for food.

193.title: Laura Willings: Care Net 'Changes'
193.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Outreach Connection
plot: Dr. Debra Peppers - National Speakers Association, and Hall of fame teacher provides tools for positive change in lives and the community with the bible. Featuring guests from the Christian ministry they represent.::Bryan Kreutz
